snippet: There has been a broad-based effort this year to keep the Jerusalem Day march from teetering into outright violence, as it did last summer.
abstract: Israel's yearly Jerusalem Day march, staged to celebrate country's unification of city in 1967 war, has taken on increasingly nationalistic tone, with fights sometimes breaking out between Israelis and Palestinians; many Palestinians describe event as symbol of Israeli power over them.
lead_paragraph: There has been a broad-based effort this year to keep the Jerusalem Day march from teetering into outright violence, as it did last summer.

headline.main: A Celebration of Jerusalem’s Unification Helps Point Up Its Divisions
headline.print_headline: Israeli Celebration of Jerusalem’s Unification Points Up Its Divisions

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Assn for Civil Rights in Israel
